solution_line_template: Half as many legs as a single spider has is {legs_per_spider}/{half_divisor}=<<{legs_per_spider}/{half_divisor}={half_legs}>>{half_legs} legs.
10 more spiders than half as many legs as a single spider has is {half_legs}+{additional_spiders}={total_spiders} spiders.
The total number of spider legs in a group of {total_spiders} spiders is {legs_per_spider}*{total_spiders}=<<{legs_per_spider}*{total_spiders}={total_legs}>>{total_legs} spider legs.
